result.execSummary:
The defendant Keontae L Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Continue in school. Do not drive unless properly licensed & obtain a valid drivers license. Write a letter of apology to the victim and turn it into the agent. No contact with the victim L.A.F. (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co defendants. Report to Harvest Consulting to enroll in counseling. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keontae L Howard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Count 1- 3 Years WPS, 18 Months init, 18 Months es, i/s, 2 Years Probation

Conditions:
90 days RCJ - STAYED
Continue in school
Do not drive unless properly licensed and obtain a valid license
Write a letter of apology to the victim and turn it into the agent
20 hours of community service work
No drugs, no alcohol
No contact with the victim
No contact with the co defendants
Report to Harvest Consulting to enroll in counseling
Court costs are waived
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge
$100 restitution to be joint and several with the co defendants
Bond money to be applied to ZCI fees 
FAW
VOTE
Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked

Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Dirk C. Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  PLQ has been filed.  Plea to charge as PTAC.  Def. pleas  G and is found G by the Court.  BTC:  PSI ordered  Defense req. removal of ZCI because of fees.  Mother MT speaks to the court.  BTC:  req. to remove ZCI monitoring is denied.  Defendant is to  have a 5 pm curfew.  Defendant is scheduled to begin Gateway in May.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keontae L Howard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Ready to proceed with trial.
BTC: Adj

ADDRESS INFO for Keontae L Howard
Current: 1657 N. Wisconsin Street, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 01-08-2016)
Prior: 1628 Morton Ave, Racine, WI 53403 United States

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $2,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). LAF & WBY  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the co-defendant. CDB & DP  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions would be to court and meeting with atty.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
10/16/15 - BOND AMENDED: Defendant may leave home for work search - 2 hrs daily, and release if employment obtained. May attend school at Gateway.

AMENDED 1/8/2016: Place on house arrest and must be home by 5pm. May leave the home for job search and school.
